title: Neural Q-learning for solving PDEs. (arXiv:2203.17128v2 [math.NA] UPDATED)
abstract: Solving high-dimensional partial differential equations (PDEs) is a major challenge in scientific computing. We develop a new numerical method for solving elliptic-type PDEs by adapting the Q-learning algorithm in reinforcement learning. Our "Q-PDE" algorithm is mesh-free and therefore has the potential to overcome the curse of dimensionality. Using a neural tangent kernel (NTK) approach, we prove that the neural network approximator for the PDE solution, trained with the Q-PDE algorithm, converges to the trajectory of an infinite-dimensional ordinary differential equation (ODE) as the number of hidden units $\rightarrow \infty$. For monotone PDE (i.e. those given by monotone operators, which may be nonlinear), despite the lack of a spectral gap in the NTK, we then prove that the limit neural network, which satisfies the infinite-dimensional ODE, converges in $L^2$ to the PDE solution as the training time $\rightarrow \infty$. translated_abstract: 解决高维偏微分方程是科学计算中的一个主要挑战。本文通过改进强化学习中的Q-学习算法开发了一种新的解决椭圆型PDE的数值方法。我们的“Q-PDE”算法是无网格的，因此具有克服维度灾难的潜力。我们使用神经切向核（NTK）方法证明，使用Q-PDE算法训练的PDE解的神经网络逼近器，随着隐藏层单元数的增加，收敛于无穷维常微分方程（ODE）的轨迹。对于单调PDE（即由单调算符给出的可能是非线性的PDE），尽管NTK中缺乏谱间隙，我们证明了满足无穷维ODE的极限神经网络会随着训练时间的增加收敛于$L^2$中的PDE解。更一般地说，我们可以证明wi的任何不动点都是该无穷维ODE的解。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的利用神经Q-学习算法解决椭圆型PDE数值方法，该算法无网格且具有克服维度灾难的潜力。本文证明了这种方法的有效性，并在单调PDE的情况下得到了极限神经网络收敛于PDE解的证明。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new numerical method for solving elliptic-type PDEs utilizing the neural Q-learning algorithm. The "Q-PDE" algorithm is mesh-free and can potentially overcome the curse of dimensionality. The paper proves the effectiveness of the method and provides a proof for the convergence of the limit neural network to the PDE solution in the case of monotone PDEs.
